context_of_use: This use case allows a manager to review and approve customer orders to avoid delays in business processes.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Wants to ensure timely approval of orders to maintain business efficiency.
customers: Expect their orders to be processed quickly to enhance satisfaction.
business owners: Require efficient order management to optimize revenue.
description: Allows a manager to review and approve customer orders to avoid delays in business processes.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending customer orders awaiting approval.
postconditions: The selected customer orders are approved by the manager.
The system updates the order status to reflect approval.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display pending orders for approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to view pending orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve selected orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval.
main_flow: 1. Manager initiates the order approval process → System displays a list of pending orders.
2. Manager selects an order to approve → System highlights the selected order details.
3. Manager confirms the approval of the selected order → System updates the order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If there are no pending orders, the system informs the manager that there are no orders to approve.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the order approval fails, the system notifies the manager of the failure and suggests retrying the approval.
